snippet: The plan seeks to address criticism aired in the wake of the attacks in Paris, but its emphasis on monitoring immigrant areas has proved controversial.
abstract: Belgium announces reforms aimed at addressing police department lapses that allowed Paris attackers to go undetected in country; plan will double spending on police, intelligence and justice departments and add 1,000 officers in canal zone in Brussels by 2019; scheme's emphasis on monitoring immigrant areas has drawn criticism.
lead_paragraph: The plan seeks to address criticism aired in the wake of the attacks in Paris, but its emphasis on monitoring immigrant areas has proved controversial.

headline.main: Belgium to Double Spending on Police and Intelligence
headline.print_headline: Belgium Opts to Double Its Spending on Security
